thread.title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Shaquille O'Neal scares the bejesus out of ESPN's Sage Steele | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Shaquille O'Neal scares the bejesus out of ESPN's Sage Steele | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nick Birdsong
title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Shaquille O'Neal scares the bejesus out of ESPN's Sage Steele | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 19, 2017 8:24pm EST February 19, 2017 8:24pm EST You'd be frightened if a 7-foot-1, 330-plus pounder crept up behind you Shaquille O'Neal (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:24 p.m. ET 
Updated at 8:24 p.m. ET 
Shaquille O'Neal is a very large man. 
At 7-1 and weighing in at well, well over 300 pounds, the NBA Hall-of-Famer and TNT basketball analyst shouldn't be able to creep up on anybody. 
But the former Magic/Lakers/Heat/Suns/Cavs/Celtics center is known for his nimbleness (Remember when he could breakdance?). He's also quite the jokester. Sunday, he slyly positioned himself behind ESPN personality Sage Steele while she was doing a sideline report before tipoff of the NBA All-Star game at Smoothie King Center in New Orleans. 
She completely lost it when she turned around and saw a grinning O'Neal.
